test-environment.gawk: GNU Awk 5.1.0, API: 3.0 (GNU MPFR 4.1.0, GNU MP 6.2.1)

tests.name: rotate a by 0, same output as input
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=0 <<< "a"
assert_success
assert_output "a"

tests.name: rotate a by 1
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=1 <<< "a"
assert_success
assert_output "b"

tests.name: rotate a by 26, same output as input
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=26 <<< "a"
assert_success
assert_output "a"

tests.name: rotate m by 13
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=13 <<< "m"
assert_success
assert_output "z"

tests.name: rotate n by 13 with wrap around alphabet
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=13 <<< "n"
assert_success
assert_output "a"

tests.name: rotate capital letters
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=5 <<< "OMG"
assert_success
assert_output "TRL"

tests.name: rotate spaces
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=5 <<< "O M G"
assert_success
assert_output "T R L"

tests.name: rotate numbers
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=4 <<< "Testing 1 2 3 testing"
assert_success
assert_output "Xiwxmrk 1 2 3 xiwxmrk"

tests.name: rotate punctuation
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=21 <<< "Let's eat, Grandma!"
assert_success
assert_output "Gzo'n zvo, Bmviyhv!"

tests.name: rotate all letters
tests.test_code:
run gawk -f rotational-cipher.awk -v distance=13 <<< "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
assert_success
assert_output "Gur dhvpx oebja sbk whzcf bire gur ynml qbt."
